summary: This is an FBI letter to USCIS regarding an individual (name redacted) who cooperated in the federal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter confirms the individual briefly departed the U.S. in February 2021 in connection with an E-2 visa and returned on February 15, 2021, resuming cooperation with the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject, along with Ghislaine Maxwell, of the federal investigation in which the redacted individual cooperated.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject, along with Jeffrey Epstein, of the federal investigation in which the redacted individual cooperated.

events.title: Cooperator's Brief Departure from U.S.
events.description: A cooperating individual (name redacted) briefly departed the United States in connection with an E-2 visa, with the FBI's knowledge and expectation of her return to continue cooperating.

events.title: Cooperator's Return to U.S.
events.description: The cooperating individual returned to the United States and resumed her cooperation in the federal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, New York, New York 10278
USCIS 38 River Road, Essex Junction, Vermont 05479
keyFacts: An individual (name redacted) cooperated in the federal investigation regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The individual briefly departed the U.S. in February 2021 in connection with an E-2 visa but returned on February 15, 2021.
The FBI expected the individual to be available and physically present in the U.S. in connection with the ongoing investigation.
The individual assured the FBI of continued participation in the investigation upon her return.
The document is an FBI letter dated August 9, 2022, addressed to USCIS's Humanitarian Division.
